caption: A nice and quiet respite to sit and relax or have your lunch after going to the markets. Beautiful park with ping pong tables. Lots of seats abound and surrounded by greenery all around.

Located near the boulevard Voltaire, Bastille and Place de La Nation.  Really nice parc/ jardin to be chilling at, read a book or just sit down and relax. Nice neighborhood to see Paris and enjoy the cafe near by.
Square established in the early-1900s. Built on a former site of a children‚Äôs hospital. Now a playground.

Are you near Bastille and your child feels bored from all day long hiking from one landmark to another? Just take a snack from the grocery store and have a break in this beautiful city playground. We enjoyed at least an hour in this park and the kids were happy and motivated to see new things in Paris.
Great park to relax and eat while kids play

We take our granddaughter to visit many parks with playgrounds. This one is one of the BEST. It is not covered in cigarette butts like so many other playgrounds in Paris, but instead, it is covered with a soft surface to prevent serious injuries if children should fall while venturing to the next level on the climbers. The many benches that line the park are NOT covered in pigeon poop. There is a very wide variety of play apparatus for children of all ages. It is a few steps from March√© D'Aligre, and the surrounding streets provide choices for treats such as delicious patisseries, coffee, or local ice cream. Large trees provide shade, and a bandstand in the middle lets the children 'perform' to their heart's desire. There are ping pong tables as well. Well done, Paris!

Is it Place des Vosages? Definitely not. It is a decent neighborhood park tucked away with some good restaurants and bakeries. I bumped it to 4-stars because of the random concerts and kid activities that happen there (playground, merry go round, etc.).

Beautiful city garden surrounded by caf√©s, restaurants and a world-famous pastry shop. There is also a playground and a bandstand where on certain Sundays amateur brass bands play. Parisian charm at its best.
Great neighborhood park! Plenty of space for kids to play and run! There is also a playground for kids!
Nice park, great place for kids. Lots of benches.

If you go to paris, there is one place you have to go before the Eiffel tower, ( was born and raised in Paris , trust me on this). I have been going several time to this place, never ever disappointed, lamb chops, the tartare, the fries, not mentioning the amazing entrec√¥te, lets not forget their ¬´¬†lemon tarte¬†¬ª or tarte au citron. You feel home , owner treat you like you belong here.  A glass of wine , take a seat on the north terrace,  and you will feel like a true parisian. I left paris 10 years ago, my annual Parisian ‚Äúshot‚Äù is square trousseau.
Top like 8 years ago. And Saturday market nearby place d'Aligre. Worth his 10 minutes walk from Gare de Lyon
Beautiful, peaceful park. Quiet, very green.
lovely place to enjoy with friends and family
New attractions since September 2019
Very nice
Perfect for a break
Superb, lots of games for all ages, the children had a blast.

Pretty tree-lined square, relaxation areas and play areas are available. The garden, named after the French doctor Armand Trousseau (1801-1867), is located on the site of the foundling hospice, built in 1674, transformed in 1880 into a children's hospital. Deemed too dilapidated, the hospital was demolished in 1902 and transferred to rue Michel Bizot. A twisted locust tree, a soap tree and an Amur philodendron rub shoulders with heather plants, flowering hawthorns and clumps of boxwood.

It is especially at the end of the evening that we evaluate the quality of a service. When the bill is paid. The drama! An undignified boss, very poorly educated (who turns his head when you speak to him). Brief‚Ä¶ Go there for the fame (no more disgusting elsewhere) but not for the service!

Square Trousseau is a very pleasant park for a small or large break for people who work nearby..... And especially for the people who live there, to go with their children to spend an afternoon..... You will find slides, ping-pong, etc.....  There are always people in this park üëåüèº
Large, friendly square with lots of games. Just a lot of people on weekends and Wednesdays and little chance of having a free bench to sit on while waiting for the children to let off steam.

A relatively large square. It is located in the heart of a neighborhood. Don't go there for the plants because they are rather aging but for the peace and quiet. There is a music kiosk there and from time to time you have the chance to attend a small concert.
Human-sized park, numerous games for children, especially young ones. Ping-pong table and table for playing checkers. A nice stop with our 2 year old child after a good walk.
Nice children's park, we passed by there thinking it was a normal park but we saw that it is geared more towards taking children.
Well maintained Ideal for sitting down and chatting however there are peak hours it is full at a certain time  Otherwise the square has a ping-pong table üèì a child‚Äôs play feel
A nice little park a few steps from the metro. . I felt safe eating a sandwich there.
The square was under construction all summer, so the games are brand new, and there are something for all ages, there are picnic tables, practical üëçüëç ‚Ä¶
Pleasant garden (1906) with its locust tree (false acacia), its small rustic soap tree and its philodendron (climbing plant). It overlooks the rue du Faubourg St Antoine Worth your visit...

I discovered it while hiking near my house during a family trip. There was a small stage here where performances could be performed, and there were also 4-5 table tennis tables. When I visited in the afternoon with my children, I saw local residents come out and play with their children for a while. There was a McDonald's nearby so there were a lot of people eating there. It's not a huge place, but I think it's a good place to come with children.
Lots of fun games for kids

An institution in the neighborhood. The play structures are numerous and well designed. Shady. Ping pong tables, benches and picnic tables on site.  Space despite the crowds (prefer in the morning).  On the edge: a toy store and an ice cream parlor.
Very nice place for families but it lacks good cleaning and supervision because teenagers ride on the games intended for 4ns and under

A very nice square with ping pong tables for players, kiosks for art lovers, play areas for children aged 2 to 10 and finally benches for those interested but who don't have not the courage to move. In short, a very nice park during the day, I highly recommend it if you have young children and live nearby!
Very good for little ones, but given the crowds, you have to have a good eye.

Great park for children with lots of games. It‚Äôs a shame that young people allow themselves to roll and smoke their joint in front of 2 year old children. To believe that it is normal and accepted by everyone. In short, when we all let it happen, we know where it leads us.

A superb place to relax in the heart of the city. The children's play area (slides), the Ping Ping tables, the table for playing checkers, and the tables are facilities that will appeal to families... Strolling around there, reading, writing or daydreaming will give you peace of mind.
Very beautiful square. Well equipped for children. There are also ping-pong tables and a superb bandstand where concerts or events just for dancing are organized from time to time. To discover. Nd.
